data.title: Ferdinand of Aragon - Vocab, Definition, and Must Know Facts
data.meta_description: Ferdinand II was the King of Aragon from 1479 until his death in 1516. He is best known for sponsoring Christopher Columbus' voyage to the Americas and for his marriage to Isabella I of Castile, which led to the unification of Spain.
data.text:
Definition

Ferdinand II was the King of Aragon from 1479 until his death in 1516. He is best known for sponsoring Christopher Columbus' voyage to the Americas and for his marriage to Isabella I of Castile, which led to the unification of Spain.
